story:
Our Story


THE BOOBY PRIZE is an 'UPLIFTING' comedy celebrating the boob-a-liciousness in all of us!


Written/Performed by Lizzie Czerner

Directed by Jeffrey Wylie


To look at writer/performer, Lizzie Czerner, one might say that she is "blessed", but Lizzie never considered having large breasts much of a blessing.  She was teased as an adolescent, and as an adult, she received the sort of male attention that is usually reserved for blow-up dolls and other specialty store items.  As a result, Lizzie spent most of her life trying to hide her "blessings", wearing bulky sweatshirts and anything tent-like that she could find.  But one day in her mid 30's, Lizzie had the sudden realization that by hiding her boobs away from the world, she was also hiding HERSELF.  She knew that life was passing her by, and she was not living it...


THE BOOBY PRIZE is about one woman's decision to come out of hiding and experience life.  The message of the show is that on the journey to find love, one must first find love of SELF.


Lizzie Czerner and Jeffrey Wylie are proud to bring THE BOOBY PRIZE to the stage this summer in Los Angeles, at THE HOLLYWOOD FRINGE FESTIVAL (June 16-26) and in New York City, at THE NEW YORK INTERNATIONAL FRINGE FESTIVAL (Aug. 12-28). 


The Impact:


THE BOOBY PRIZE will donate 25% of online donations, as well as a percentage of ticket sale proceeds, to the KEEP A BREAST FOUNDATION.  (This show is not about breast cancer, but the disease has touched Lizzie's family personally, and the issue of prevention is even closer to her heart than her boobs are!) 


What We Need

Who knew festivals were so expensive?!  Lizzie is eternally grateful to Jeffrey Wylie, who is (miraculously) donating his time as her Director, and she hopes you will want to donate too to help keep this project going and bring boobaliciousness to the world! :)  (If you are unable to donate monetarily, we would be equally grateful for donated services, or for those who wish to volunteer time during either the L.A. or N.Y.C. festivals to help make the show a success!)


*At this point I would like to remind friends & family that I have never had a Bat Mitzvah, wedding, baby shower, or expensive rite of passage of any kind. - So just think of all the money I have saved you over the years!  ;)


Here is a break-down of costs for both fests combined:


Festival registration fees - $850 

Venue fees - $700

Cost for online/print ads in guides and trade magazines - $800

Cost for postcards/flyers/posters/press kits - $600

Cost for street team to hand out marketing materials and talk up the show - $250

Airfare for two to NYC from LA and back -  $1000

Room and board for two in NYC for the month of August -  $1000

Publicist - $1000

Website design and online marketing campaign - $500

Postage to send postcards to people in the entertainment industry so they know what we're up to - $300

Programs  - $600

Tech Director - $400


TOTAL = $8,000*


*Some of these costs are estimates... Many are likely to be UNDER-estimates, a fact to which I'm sure some of you more seasoned producers can attest.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word about THE BOOBY PRIZE!  We appreciate any tweeting, yelping, facebooking, etc. that you are able to do on our behalf.  - Also - If you have any media contacts who might want to come to the show and write a review, please contact us at theboobyprize2011@gmail.com and let us know!  Finally, if you know of any other ways that we can cut the costs listed above, we would love you eternally and make you cupcakes.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!!
story_txt:
Our Story

THE BOOBY PRIZE is an 'UPLIFTING' comedy celebrating the boob-a-liciousness in all of us!

Written/Performed by Lizzie Czerner
Directed by Jeffrey Wylie

To look at writer/performer, Lizzie Czerner, one might say that she is "blessed", but Lizzie never considered having large breasts much of a blessing.  She was teased as an adolescent, and as an adult, she received the sort of male attention that is usually reserved for blow-up dolls and other specialty store items.  As a result, Lizzie spent most of her life trying to hide her "blessings", wearing bulky sweatshirts and anything tent-like that she could find.  But one day in her mid 30's, Lizzie had the sudden realization that by hiding her boobs away from the world, she was also hiding HERSELF.  She knew that life was passing her by, and she was not living it...
THE BOOBY PRIZE is about one woman's decision to come out of hiding and experience life.  The message of the show is that on the journey to find love, one must first find love of SELF.

Lizzie Czerner and Jeffrey Wylie are proud to bring THE BOOBY PRIZE to the stage this summer in Los Angeles, at THE HOLLYWOOD FRINGE FESTIVAL (June 16-26) and in New York City, at THE NEW YORK INTERNATIONAL FRINGE FESTIVAL (Aug. 12-28).  


The Impact:
THE BOOBY PRIZE will donate 25% of online donations, as well as a percentage of ticket sale proceeds, to the KEEP A BREAST FOUNDATION.  (This show is not about breast cancer, but the disease has touched Lizzie's family personally, and the issue of prevention is even closer to her heart than her boobs are!)  

What We Need 

Who knew festivals were so expensive?!  Lizzie is eternally grateful to Jeffrey Wylie, who is (miraculously) donating his time as her Director, and she hopes you will want to donate too to help keep this project going and bring boobaliciousness to the world! :)  (If you are unable to donate monetarily, we would be equally grateful for donated services, or for those who wish to volunteer time during either the L.A. or N.Y.C. festivals to help make the show a success!)

*At this point I would like to remind friends & family that I have never had a Bat Mitzvah, wedding, baby shower, or expensive rite of passage of any kind. - So just think of all the money I have saved you over the years!  ;)

Here is a break-down of costs for both fests combined:

Festival registration fees - $850  
Venue fees - $700
Cost for online/print ads in guides and trade magazines - $800
Cost for postcards/flyers/posters/press kits - $600
Cost for street team to hand out marketing materials and talk up the show - $250
Airfare for two to NYC from LA and back -  $1000
Room and board for two in NYC for the month of August -  $1000
Publicist - $1000
Website design and online marketing campaign - $500
Postage to send postcards to people in the entertainment industry so they know what we're up to - $300
Programs  - $600
Tech Director - $400

TOTAL = $8,000*

*Some of these costs are estimates... Many are likely to be UNDER-estimates, a fact to which I'm sure some of you more seasoned producers can attest. 


Other Ways You Can HelpPlease help us spread the word about THE BOOBY PRIZE!  We appreciate any tweeting, yelping, facebooking, etc. that you are able to do on our behalf.  - Also - If you have any media contacts who might want to come to the show and write a review, please contact us at theboobyprize2011@gmail.com and let us know!  Finally, if you know of any other ways that we can cut the costs listed above, we would love you eternally and make you cupcakes.THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT!!

story:
A LITTLE BACKGROUND

BURNT UMBER was originally commissioned/workshopped by Crowded Fire Theater Company and Playwrights Foundation (SF). Workshops followed at New Dramatists (NYC), Arena Stage (DC) and most recently with the current cast at Powerhouse/New York Stage and Film (Vassar). Though it takes place in Tulsa in 2007, BURNT UMBER is haunted by the events of the Tulsa Race Riots (1921), Rwandan genocide (1994), and the Bosnian ethnic cleansing campaign and genocide in Srebrenica (1992-1995). The characters somnabulently orbit around this domestic American drama in an atmosphere of neglect, denial, and communication breakdown-elements known to successfully break a family apart, or in a different context, allow a genocidal act to occur. The play explores what can happen when some of us aren't looking or others simply decide not to look.

HELP US MEET OUR GOAL

We need to raise $5,000 in the next 4 weeks to cover rehearsal space rental, design materials and pay for our hardworking creative team. We can only reach our goal with the support of artistic patrons like you, who value new work that engages artists and our community in important conversations about the culture we live in.

HELP US START A CONVERSATION

The subject of genocide is both unfathomable and unruly in its size and permutations. So how can we ask our audience to walk away from Soulographie with a clear understanding of what genocide means? We can't. We can only invite you to join a conversation with a body of work that perhaps can shed a tiny shaft of light on how the circumstances that make space for these horrific events continue to take place over and over again.

VIDEO

Here's a small window into our process! In our research, we discovered a series of drawings made by children living in war-torn communities across the globe. We began to incorporate projections of evocative abstract drawings that leave room for the audience to process, interpret, and come to incomprehensible images with their own associations;much like one might approach the subject of genocide: as if through a prism, its image unfixed, carrying with it too many complicated, fragmented associations to immediately define a simple relationship to it. We also composed some heartbreakingly beautiful music to introduce a hopeful counterpoint to the darkness of the piece. This video gives a little taste of the projections and music we explored in our workshops.

CAN'T CONTRIBUTE FUNDS? THERE ARE OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If you can't contribute, here are a few ways you can help! Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi! My name is Dee Smith. The Producer of this project!
 
"The Last Days of Judas Iscariot"
 
We are launching our IndieGoGo campaign to raise additional funding to produce a professional (AEA) six-week engagement of this remarkable play at the Victory Theatre in Los Angeles. This project is very important to us because it deals with humanity on a very intimate level. It speaks to the "cause and effect" of our actions in this life and deals so honestly with the condition of the human soul.

 What We Need

We are looking to raise a minimum of 10,000 to make this a reality. The funding will be used to pay for the rental space of the theater, all production cost and actors pay

The Impact: Making a Place for Ourselves

By donating to this project you will be supporting a piece of art that has the capacity to start dialogue; to effect change; to touch lives in ways that are often unexpected and intangible.

Your donation will be crucial in helping to bring about a fully-realized, thought provoking piece of theatre that for us, is just the launching pad for more productions to come!

You Can Help!!!

Even if you can't donate right now, you can help us by spreading the word!!  Make some noise about our campaign, post the link on Facebook, use the IndieGoGo share tools...tell all your friends!  Everything counts.  We believe that what we do is truly worth it, and hope you do to.  We are placing our future in your hands, and couldn't be prouder to do so.

 Broadway World Article:

http://losangeles.broadwayworld.com/article/THE-LAST-DAYS-OFJUDAS-ISCARIOT-Opens-31-at-The-Victory-Theater-20121210

 Bitter-Lemons Article:

http://losangeles.bitter-lemons.com/2012/12/16/the-last-days-of-judas-iscariot-continues-to-find-life/

story:
FUNDRAISER JUNE 29TH!  https://www.facebook.com/events/377448755693610...

Amori’s Casino & Burlesque will be a late night venue featuring gaming tables, cabaret, burlesque, magic and comedy acts.

Amori’s Casino & Burlesque will be set in an intimate circus like atmosphere housed inside of a 40 x 40 circus tent. The exterior will boast a wrap around façade styled to look like an Italian villa complete with faux marble and Roman columns and include a wooden patio with tables and chairs for outdoor seating.

The interior will be decorated in rich red velvets and silks with low, ambient lighting to create an intimate, sexy environment. The stage will be the focal point of the entertainment and be surrounded by comfortable seating and a perimeter of gaming tables.

The festivities will include jugglers, comedians, vaudeville, skits, music, contortion, aerial, belly dance, roaming characters and pole dancers, all hosted by the Mayor himself.

And each and every night Los Angeles’ very own “New Fangled Opry” will be presenting a show that will leave your sides in stitches.

Other featured performers include; Helles Belles, Fire Groove, and Cat Healy Entertainment.

While the live performances will be the main focus of Amori’s, no casino would be complete without tables, dealers and multiple Vegas-style games. All gaming will be for fun and prizes. And all guests will be able walk away with LIB 2013 commemorative poker chips!

When the music shuts down amori’s will be the place to be!

story:
Short Summary

Artists In Motion (AIM) is a multidisciplinary dance company that bridges the gap between various styles of dance.
 
We are passionate about the art of dance and committed to the exponential growth of the industry here in Canada.

As we begin our 2013 season we are anticipating the company's premiere production, "Pandora's Box- Is evil born or made?" The production examines the consciousness of the mind and the spectrum of "evils" that exist not only throughout humanity, but within oneself.
Premiering March 16th at the Al Green Theater

What We Need & What You Get

Artists In Motion strives to only produce the best. In order to achieve our goal we need your assistance. Your conribution will aid the costs of:

-Rental of the Al Green Theater
-Costuming for the cast
-Natalia Kudashkina/face paint artist
-Lighting designer
-Photographer/Videographer
-Program/Poster/Flyer/Ticket printing and promotions
-Compensation for the performers involved in "Pandora's Box"

The Impact

We are so grateful for your donations and generosity. Your contribution, big or small, will assist our company in the most positive light. Furthermore it will help us inspire those around us and reach individuals outside the dance community.

AIM uniquely and creatively demonstrates Toronto's/Canada's diversity both culturally and in dance. AIM provides an outlet for dance artists by giving them opportunities to perform, gain knowledge about the industry and train in multiple genres of dance forms. As a result, we are able to reach a variety of students in the community based on our diversity.
With your help we can continue serving our community through the arts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about AIM Dance Company and Pandora's Box! Follow us on twitter @aimtoronto and  join our Artists In Motion (A.I.M) Dance Company facebook group. Most importantly, share with your friends and help us spread the necessity of dance and art in Toronto/Canada! Suggest this donation page to your friends and help us reach our goal.
 

Thank You for supporting Artists in Motion without you we would not be able to do what we do. Thank you!!

story:
What's the deal?

Persephone Productions is a Montreal based theatre company. We are engaging donors through Indiegogo to help our upcoming production of SPRING AWAKENING: THE MUSICAL (book and lyrics by Steven Sater, Music by Duncan Sheik - based on the play by Frank Wedekind). All donations over $40 will receive a tax receipt.

Who is Persephone?

Persephone Productions is a not-for-profit theatre company (and registered charity) mandated to provide experience and exposure to young artists and to foster a collaborative work environment.

Founded on the belief that the greatness of any city depends on the state of its cultural events and the health of its artistic community, Persephone Productions seeks to acknowledge the importance of theatre in our lives by creating opportunities for young artists to find their place and make a contribution.

The company is committed to presenting plays that are innovative and of literary merit and social significance.

Why do we need your help?

Persephone does not currently receive any outside funding aside from donations. 

While we are very excited to bring this powerful show to the Montreal stage, it is one of the most expensive and ambitious shows we have ever attempted. 

Why contribute?

By contributing to our campaign, your support will be two-fold!

Firstly, this musical explores themes that are just as relevant and in need of discussion today as they were when the original play was written in the 19th century. Several of the themes include sexual repression, abortion, homosexuality, school pressures, rape, abuse, and teen suicide. Each one a relevant hot topic in it's own right, the musical weaves together each of these important issues with delicacy and honesty. Aside from being a beautiful story, the show acts as an aid to help further discussions into areas where exposure and understanding are sadly still inadequate.

On top of supporting an important piece of work, your contributions will support the future of young artists! Persephone exists solely to give a chance to emerging artists, in a community that is arguably lacking in opportunities.

What is the money for?

By contributing towards the price of the theatre space for our production, you will let us free up our current modest funds to other ares of the production, including: fees for all artists involved, materials for costumes and set, rental of audio equipment, cost of rights to do the show, etc.  

Will indiegogo cover all costs?

Not quite! With the projected amount these contributions will amount for less than 20% of our overall cost. That being said, it is a HUGE help!!!

Can I come see the show?

Of course you can! We will run from October 17-27 at 3819, rue Calixa-Lavallée. Tickets can be purchased at https://www.showtix4u.com or check our website for more details: www.persephoneproductions.org

How else can I help?

You can also send donations through https://www.canadahelps.org/dn/11601 or email persephoneproductions@gmail.com for further info on how to donor or sponsor.

You can also spread the word about our production and this very campaign!

Anything else to know?

Perhaps? Feel free to get in touch with us! There is a contact form on our website! There, you can also have a look at all the talent about to take to the stage!
